page.title: 11DEPRIVATION
page.content: TO TACKLE THE PROBLEM OF MULTIPLE DEPRIVATION IN THE WEST OF SCOTLAND BROUGHT ABOUT BY THE TWIN EVILS OF HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT AND THE INABILITY OF LOCAL AUTHORITIES TO CONTINUE ADEQUATE SERVICES BECAUSE OF GOVERNMENT CUT-BACKS, STRATHCLYDE REGIONAL COUNCIL IDENTIFIED {AREAS OF PRIORITY {TREATMENT.}SERIOUS AND SENSITIVE INTERAGENCY WORK WAS TO BE UNDERTAKEN IN THE MOST DISADVANTAGED AREAS WHERE A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE POPULATION SEEMS AT THE MOMENT TO BE DOOMED TO PERMANENT UNEMPLOYMENT. {THE VILLAGE {OF PLAINS IN EAST MONKLANDS, WITH AN {UNEMPLOYMENT RATE OF 36%}OBVIOUSLY WARRANTED AND WAS GRANTED A.P.T. STATUS. EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON COMMUNITIES IDENTIFYING THEIR OWN NEEDS AND PLANNING AND RUNNING THEIR OWN PROJECTS TO HELP THEIR OWN AREA.
